page.title: 03The Church. St Nicholas
page.content: The church which is near one corner of the village has been on the same site since at least 1087 when the last Domesday Book was compiled. It has been altered and rebuilt several times throughout the centuries. The vicar,the Revd.Dr.'Ted' Lurking, who lives in Potterspury, is also responsible for the churches at Yardley Gobion and Cosgrove. Each week in the church there is a practice session for the choir and during some days the fine organ can be heard as the organist practices. The graveyard on the church grounds has not been used for about 100 years and burials now all take place in the cemetery on the corner of the High Street.
